constituent: red, soil, dirt, ground, sword, dagger, small
heisigComment: * As a primitive on the left, this kanji keeps the same form. Elsewhere, the first two strokes are abbreviated to a single dot. This latter form will take the meaning of an apple.
heisigStory: Ground . . . dagger . . . little. The two strokes of the dagger take the place of the middle stroke of little.
koohiiStory1: He was stabbed with a dagger, and little drops of red blood dropped onto the ground.
koohiiStory2: There was red all over the soil after Little Red Riding Hood plunged a dagger into the wolf. Those two dots we see are wolfies animal legs we see, by the way (a la smithsonian).
kunYomi: あか、あか-、あか.い、あか.らむ、あか.らめる
readingExamples: 赤道 (せきどう), 赤貧 (せきひん), 発赤 (はつあか), 赤 (あか), 赤い (あか.い), 赤らむ (あか.らむ), 赤らめる (あか.らめる)
words: to become red, to redden, to blush
